  • Method Details

    • refreshUserAuthentication

      public void refreshUserAuthentication() throws org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException
      Refreshes the current user's authentication by reloading the user details using the current username (typically the email).

      This method is useful when the user's data has changed (e.g., roles, permissions) and needs to be reloaded into the security context without requiring the user to log out and log back in.

      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException - if the user cannot be found using the current username

    • refreshUserAuthenticationById

      public void refreshUserAuthenticationById() throws org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException
      Refreshes the current user's authentication by reloading the user details using the internal user ID.

      This is a safer alternative to refreshUserAuthentication() in cases where the username (email) may have changed, ensuring the correct user is reloaded based on a stable identifier.

      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException - if the user cannot be found using their internal ID

    • autoLoginUserByEmail

      public void autoLoginUserByEmail(String email) throws org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException
      Automatically authenticates and logs in a user based on their email address.

      This method performs the following steps:

      • Loads user details by the provided email
      • Creates an authentication token for the user
      • Creates and sets a new SecurityContext with the authentication
      • Binds the security context to the current HTTP session to maintain the authenticated state
      This allows seamless login without requiring manual input of credentials, commonly used after registration or email verification flows.

      Parameters:
      email - the email address of the user to be automatically logged in
      Throws:
      org.springframework.security.core.userdetails.UsernameNotFoundException - if no user is found with the given email
